body.p: 1. Zabdiel’s son who was put in charge of David’s “Three” mightiest men (1 Chr 11:11) and also appointed chief of a division (24,000 soldiers) on duty in the first month of the year (1 Chr 27:2). He is the same person as Josheb-basshebeth, the Tahkemonite (2 Sm 23:8, nlt mg). Jashobeam gained renown by killing 300 men, according to 1 Chronicles 11:11, or 800, according to 2 Samuel 23:8.
2. One of the ambidextrous warriors who joined David at Ziklag (1 Chr 12:6).
